turn.1: What was the title of the movie Hand That Rocks the Cradle?
turn.2: Hand That Rocks the Cradle  Hand That Rocks the Cradle is an American silent film released in 1917.
turn.4: It was written, produced and directed by the husband and wife team Phillips Smalley and Lois Weber, who also play the lead roles.
turn.6: It was made in Hollywood under the working title " Is a Woman a Person?" The plot follows the careers of a husband and wife pair of activists campaigning for sex education and family planning.
turn.7: What was the most interesting fact about the movie?
turn.8: The events in the film were largely inspired by the trial of Margaret Sanger.
turn.9: Are there any other interesting aspects about this article?
turn.10: The film was an unofficial sequel to "Where Are My Children?", a 1916 film by the same team, and has been classified as a lost film.
turn.11: Did the film get any awards?
turn.12: It was not a commercial success upon its release, and Weber later claimed to be unhappy with the finished product.
